main event: On 27 February 1954 at Keesler Air Force Base, Mississippi, three military personnel reported a sighting of a solid, 15 to 20 feet in diameter, unidentified flying object. The object followed a straight course, split in two, and disappeared after about five seconds of observation.
interesting points: The object was described as being round, bright, and incandescent, with a flight path from south to north before splitting and disappearing.
The observation lasted for only 5 seconds, indicating a brief and sudden appearance of the object.
The characteristics of the sighting led to the conclusion that it was likely a meteor entering the Earth's atmosphere.
Another report on 13 January 1954 at Keesler Air Force Base involved four civilian employees observing disc-shaped objects moving at an extremely high rate of speed.
Two officers, Captain E.C. McGraw and Captain L. B. Sparks, witnessed the unidentified objects and were instructed not to disclose evidence or information about the case.
sighted object: solid, round, unidentified flying object approximately 15 to 20 feet in diameter
